Review_Date: stevemcwarburton wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Well we have just had a most wonderful 2 weeks at the Sol Oasis. The reviews we read were unanimously positive and we must agree. Being our first foreign holiday since Covid we only got our passports renewed this July we were rather apprehensive of even travelling anywhere let alone flying again to North Africa. But everything went well.  The hotel was refurbished last year and I can honestly say that we had no issues at all with anything at the hotel. The room was excellent everything functioned perfectly including the lighting door entry bathroom and shower fridge and an ace foolproof safe. The cleaner was lovely almost every day you could set your clock by the regularity of her visits plus her cheery smile. Reception staff often a letdown were efficient and pleasant and so helpful. Animation staff as unanimously praised by all reviewers were excellent and not pushy at all. Sam the main man is virtually a mouth on legs! But in a pleasant way. Top marks to Russ and his new wife Susu - what a lovely couple. Had at least 3 meals with Russ and discussed everything under the sun. They got married on November 5th so we taught him the rhyme 'Remember Remember the 5th of November' so he will hopefully not forget their first anniversary. Serving staff in the dining area were all lovely but special praise for Hicham who even made proper English tea in a teapot for us along with some lovely strong but milky coffees. Nothing was too mush trouble for him. Naoual Ilham Zakaria Jallal and Miriam were lovely. Special mention for Mohamed one of the evening waiters!  Food was superb even after 2 weeks we were still being surprised and amazed by the quality and variety. Every meal included 5 or 6 tagines and other Moroccan dishes beef and chicken and turkey were beautiful we even had minute steaks one night. Fish and crevettes were super. There is provision for pizza lovers and lasagna plus chilli con carne etc but virtually the only Western food we ate was a few chips here and there! Desserts were very varied but the Moroccan night biscuits and meringues were amazing.  One of the downfalls of most all-inclusive breaks is the wine often cheap tacky stuff from huge casks. But the wine at Sol Oasisi was of very high quaility - bottled in Spain you can even buy it on the internet! White wine was comparable to what we use at home and how many times are you offered sparkling wine? Beer was imported bottled in Portugal. We enjoyed it.  The grounds are beautiful well tended and we watched with interest as 5 olive trees were brought in on a wagon and planted by the Spa. Gardeners working every day.  Hicham the Tour Guide was most helpful certainly not pushy and helped us to confirm our return transfer via Whatsapp. This being our 3rd visit to Marrakech we weren't really interested in tours but we went on the freebie half day trip to Marrakech and used the hotel shuttle vehicle to enjoy a private potter round parts of the Medina. The shuttles ran roughly every 1.5 hours bookable in advance. Fascinating to see parts of the city on your way to and from the Medina.  We both sadly went down with a cold plus sore throat several days after we arrived but managed to get some appropriate medication at a Pharmacy just about a mile away - the walk there and back was interesting and some of my highlight photos were taken in the housing development surrounding the Pharmacy.  As with most hotels in Marrakech the hotel is roughly a 25 minute drive from the city and is located in virtually a wilderness but we enjoyed meeting up with local goat and sheep herders but what they find to eat was baffling!  In conclusion I would just like to add that this being our first trip after Covid I was so pleased we went for 2 weeks rather than our customary 10 or 11 nights. And would we go back? Certainly would probably the best and most restful holiday we have ever had.

Review_Title: Amazing place just needs minor improvements but would return and also recommend the positives out weigh the negatives
Review_Text: So to start off I really wanted to give sol oasis a 4 star however I feel this could impact the resort so I'll start with the negatives and put the positives.    ***NEGATIVES***    So to start we arrived about 10pm and was greeted by reception. I was given a key and explained what was written on the paper surrounding my card about times of restaurant and that we could book the separate restaurant 1 time during our stay (which was fully booked all week) and that was all that was explained. Someone had shown us to the room and explained everything inside and was very nice. On the days that followed nothing else was explained we had to find out from other people staying in the resort. Apparently there was a welcome meeting which we didn't know about? and some other said the same but others were told about this. Things we didn't know about There is a big white board with a schedule for each day pool towels 100 mad each as a deposit and you get the money back free shuttle bus tour guides spa service and late check out charge just some of the things. Upon checking out there was a young girl who didn't look interested and kept saying to wait on the manager which we did. The food was ok sometimes really good and sometimes it was adequate the drinks are included but some of the cocktails just weren't what they were supposed to be.    ***POSITIVES***    HOWEVER out with the negatives which could be easily sorted out and start with some positives. The staff are second to none of amazing!! They love working there and always smiling making an effort with you "SAM" was fantastic just an entertainer just lights up your day and night such a natural thing to him especially his "story's" made me laugh. "FATI" was just down to earth always great to have a chat and play games with whenever you needed something she was always there to help with or make your day easier. "Niako" was a great entertainer and fantastic dancer forever smiling I had the pleasure of having lunch with him and just makes you happy!. Unfortunately I can't remember a few others names and most of the guys outside were all great even the guys wearing the "FRAM" clothes. The bartender's are super nice always happy and would fist bump shake hands make a joke or ask how your day is going they were super nice. The restaurant staff were so good at the job there was no dishes or glasses left about and did the job with ease although they never spoke it was great. All the games were really good from volleyball to water polo archery darts football. The entertainment was great at night time and always something different each day. The pool was always clean and also the same with the loungers. The room was nice the AC was great and worked very well. Beds were changed everyday new towels also plus the shower is nice as well.  ***Conclusion***  As a whole the staff outside make this place what it is and I would recommend this place to anyone and will definitely return here. 99% of guests here were also really nice. So as a 4* resort I would say they could make this a 5* with the small changes well done sol oasis and the team 💚

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Mar 17
Review_Title: Some parts Amazing, but we ended up quite ill
Review_Text: There is a lot to like about this Hotel but there are some significant improvements needed in a small number of areas that have impacted my review.    The Good.    The Staff - 5 out of 5. I would score higher if possible all the staff we encountered were absolutely sensational. Couldn't have done more for us. The entertainment team one of the best ever Fatima Mike Fazza Wahiba - wow they were absolutely amazing. Some of the best ever. I literally loved their company they make you feel like friends it's a real skill to do this and they deserve massive praise.    Hicham and the other bar staff absolutely incredible. Work so hard remembered my order again absolutely amazing.    The Shows 5 out of 5    Again loved them some of the best we have seen. The light show was innovative and massively entertaining.    The room 4.5 out of 5    Room was lovely had everything we needed great air con. We had to navigate 20 - 30 steps up and down as we were at the back of the complex. Would have also been nice if water was topped up.    Drinks 4 out of 5    Good quality drinks even though not branded. Wine and lager both good. Marked down as its 30 euros for two vodkas and coke after 11pm which is ridiculous. Also the water service is so daft! There is a fridge next to the bar but this spends much of the day empty so if you want a bottle of water you queue with people ordering several cocktails just for one bottle of water. Just a real shame creates more pressure for the bar staff and frustration for customers.    Food 1 put of 5    Not good at all sorry but so poor. Both me and my wife got food poisoning I couldn't leave my room for the last day and my wife is now vomitting 48 hours after we left. We didn't eat or drink outside of the hotel. Understandable this ruined our experience. Whilst we hadn't massively enjoyed the food prior we got by because of how good everything else was but to then become severely ill it wasn't acceptable. Photo below of chicken that was barbecued fresh but is visibly pink thankfully it was cold to touch and I noticed with this piece but has eaten other pieces. The deserts in all fairness were tasty but everything else below average and a disappointment. Example pizzas made outside stone baked oven but the dough wasn't cooked enough. Some exceptions Burgers at dinner excellent and odd find like veg soup.    Also tongs used to serve food with sauce so you couldn't get the sauce. Several items labelled wrong and the ice cream scoop was often going back into filthy water.    Just such a shame that this wasn't better not sure if there had been a change but several other guests said this was the only part of their experience they didn't enjoy.    Grounds and setting 4 out of 5.    The Hotel is really nice kept really clean and has everything you could want. It is very far out compared to others and that's the only reason for scoring it down.    Overall    It's such a shame we ended up ill and more a shame that we didn't spot the signs earlier. A few cups had been dirty and the undercooked chicken we should have been even more vigilant.

Review_Text: LOCATION: In a nice peaceful area just 20 mins away from Marrakech by hotel's free shuttle bus. Accomodation: Comfortable rooms spread out on a large grounds. Not enough hangers and clothes hanging space. We needed kettle in the room and they were more than happy to supply one. Cleaners would clean room everyday. Service: Everybody was very happy to provide good service please guests. FOOD: There was enough variety everyday. Food was very tasty and had few different dishes everyday. Morrocan italian Med Asian etc was all good and tasty. Although food was cooked freshly everyday only criticism is that occasionally some of the dishes were luke warm or room temperature when they should have been piping hot. I did point out and they did heat my plate but again same almost everyday. Breakfast was good everyday. Morrocan theme night food was the best. At busy times you have to wait in the queue to get a bottle of water which can be annoying. They might be keeping water behind the bar to stop wastage of bottled water? FACILITIES: Clean swimming pool well equiped indoor and outdoor Gym lots of playgrounds where lots of games were organised by the Entertainment teams. Very nice play areas and pool for very young guests.  NOW THE BEST PART of this resort: ENTERTAINMENT TEAM. One of the best entertainment team we have come accross is at Sol Oasis in Marrakech. The whole team is just Super Talented. Dancing Singing Sports Creativity and most important connecting with guests are some of the skills they have. They start activities and entertainment from morning till about 11.00 at night. They have live singing and dancing every evening and live performances 3-4 time a week in the theater and outdoors. They also bring artists from outside aswell. They just work tirelessly throughout the day around the swimming pool on the terrace in play grounds theatre hall kitchen-cooking classes Guests will lot of activities to choose from throughout the day. It will be unfair to name only few entertainmenbt team members. Every single team member was great. Guests will never feel left out. They go around and ask everybody how they are doing if guest wants to take part in an activity and always make them feel at ease. They show genuine interest in staying in touch with guests. I think they have a great leader in Entertainment Teams. This Entertainment/Animation team makes up more than half of the fun staying at this resort.

Cold in mornings and evenings but when the sun came out it was beautiful (not the hotels fault of course !?)  Room was comfortable. Everything worked well. Sometimes house keeping missed our room to clean (maybe due to us being late risers?) Our Shower leaked a little bit onto the bathroom floor but this wasn’t an inconvenience. Asked for a kettle to be delivered to the room and this was handled well.  Animation team were great!! They really worked hard and tried their best to keep guests entertained (fatti Sam Mike & archery man (forget his name but sounds like he’s from Manchester lol). Shows in the evening by the team.  Plenty of food to choose from. Themed buffet every night. It did seem to get a bit repetitive (especially desserts) but there was a lot to choose from.  Pool bar staff were very efficient and hard working. Get to know them and occasionally tip and you’ll get fantastic service (they even remember your order). Queues to get drinks at busy times so perhaps they could put on some extra bar staff during peak times ??  Pool was huge and heated which was a nice touch.  Lovely open fire pits for the cold nights. A really nice touch but did get to the room at the end of the night smelling like a bonfire!?    Would definitely go back again.    One negative which is out of the hotels control…  Many many local families and kids showed little respect whilst queuing for food or drinks. They would simply push in. Kids ran riot. Their parents let them do whatever they wanted running around screaming and shouting. Very little control whatsoever. Very hazardous in the restaurant with plates and hot food around. Many kids used to pile their plates up with food just for the sake of it which was very wasteful and sad to see :(

Review_Date: Mark N wrote a review Mar 1
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakesh.    We took a chance with the Sol Oasis and found it be a nicely appointed hotel. It was clean and contrary to a number of other reviews we found the food to be varied plentiful and hot.    We had a standard room that was air conditioned clean and spacious but unfortunately had no balcony.    In fact we found the whole site to be spacious with plenty of room to host numerous sports and activities. The swimming pool was the cleanest that we’ve seen in a hotel probably because it is covered overnight.    But the real stars of the hotel were the staff. All of the animation team were friendly but not too pushy to get guests participating in activities. In particular Sam was a great master ceremonies during the week we were there.    The outside bar staff (especially Norbedine and Higham) were also friendly (apart from one occasion when another member of staff pulled the shutter down at 11pm in quite an aggressive fashion - I’ve never seen that happen at a holiday resort before) with a smile all day long (especially to those with manners…). Inside the star of the show was the lovely Hanane who ensured that my 60th birthday was suitably celebrated.    Finally a few words of caution (not complaints) for first-time visitors to Sol Oasis:    - The hotel is a good 20 minutes outside of the city. If you want a resort hotel then the Sol Oasis is perfect. But if you are making numerous trips into the city yes the free shuttle is great but you are probably better off finding somewhere in Marrakesh itself.  - Contrary to hotel advertising there is really only one main restaurant (Darna) for all your meals. That wasn’t a problem for us but some might want more variety. You can only book the Moroccan restaurant (Cafe Maure) once (as it’s included in the all-inclusive package) and the Spanish restaurant (Safran - that isn’t included) was empty virtually every night.  - The language of the hotel is predominantly French. Virtually all of the staff speak very good English and all animation announcements are in both languages. But you are likely to be frustrated at times especially when there is precious little paperwork to inform you about anything.    Overall a very pleasant stay primarily down to the hardworking staff.

Review_Date: Banksy594 wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: BE AWARE YOUR PERSONAL SAFETY MAYBE COMPROMISED IF YOU STAY HERE
Review_Text: Please be aware: Your personnal safety maybe compromised if you stay here!    I would never have thought that I would ever have to review a hotel on our travels to warn fellow travellers. I want future possible  guests to be made aware of what happened to us. Something similar or worse could occur during your stay to you or your loved ones. I would be full of extreme regret if I did not post this warning……    This all started a week into our holiday. There was what appeared to be a party in the room above us. We endured it until the early hours of the morning. Eventually we telephoned reception and someone went to their room to stop the noise. They did but as soon as the person left the music restarted and the party continued. Much later we went to reception to kindly ask them again to ask the the guests to go to bed so fellow guests could at least get some sleep. They said they would ask security to go to the room. We eventually managed to get some sleep.    The following day we asked for a meeting with Rachida Arifi from guest relations. She said that she would speak to them and Ms Arifi came back to us asking if we wanted to meet the party lads so they could apologise in person. I refused as I didn’t want them to know who we were as we had complained. We were told that there is a hotel policy that all noise should stop at midnight. However there aren’t any signs displayed anywhere or paperwork in the rooms informing guests to substantiate this claim!!!    The next evening we were in our room around 9 pm when the two men from the room above us tried to get into our room. We shouted at them through the door that the room is occupied and to leave us alone. This was intimidating and what would have happened if they had succeeded and gained entry? Assault harassment stabbing who knows? The one thing I can say it was not a mistake and they weren’t popping in to say hello. The hotel have said there’s not CCTV to prove this.    We immediately got dressed and rushed to reception. The manager was having a chat with one of the two men from the room above us. They both left and went into another room out of our view. The manager came back and my wife explained what had happened and informed him what had also happened the night before.  The manager said the two lads had just returned to the hotel by bus so it couldn’t have been them - Marrakesh is a 30 minute bus ride away.  Then he stated the two guests had now gone out and that they would be moved upon their return. However that could be 4-5 am. This didn’t make sense at all. We asked him to call the police and then the manager started to shout at us. We were taken aback as he yelled at us to call the police. He then offered us a guard outside our room for the night!! What a holiday! My wife went to look for another manager and found the head of entertainment. He was more professional and reassuring. I demanded that we change rooms immediately. Our safety had been compromised and we packed up all our things and porters helped us move. We were given the choice of two rooms one was identical to ours but had a musty smell and the other was an upgrade to a family room so we had to accept that.    The following day no one from Management came to see us and my heart had gone into irregular rhythm with all the stress. That evening the entertainment manager told us the hotel director would have a meeting with us the next day. We cancelled our day out and waited and waited but to no avail.    The next morning reception said Ms Arifi would be in 10.30-11 am and I asked for her to come and see us. The day passed and I had to go back to reception only to be told she would be in 7 pm and that’s when we finally had our meeting. She said we misunderstood there was never a meeting and the management just hid behind Ms Arifi.    A meal in the Moroccan restaurant is given to each hotel reservation so one visit as part of the holiday package. This restaurant shares the kitchen and the ONLY waiter with the Tapas restaurant next door with toilets in the middle! Bizarre but true….    We were given a second meal in this restaurant with a bottle of cheap sparkling wine due to the noise disruption!    Finally after cutting our holiday short due to everything we asked to join our friends back in the Moroccan restaurant as they had not yet had their inclusive meal there and we did.    The main breakfast lunch dinner restaurant and inside bar are not heated so this is how people dine to keep warm in bobble hats and coats etc.    Staff are very friendly and helpful especially Hicham and Nourideen from behind the bar Abdellih the waiter for Moroccan and Tapas restaurant. The entertainment crew with a special mention to Mike Fatima and Sam… this work is totally undone when guests don’t feel safe and management don’t apply duty of care.    Now Ms. Arifi will reply to this review and probably have a totally different take on our experience we hope we will not experience anything like it again and never have before. I have 125000 readers for my reviews and very well travelled fortunately around the world but we have never ever cut short our holiday as we did on this occasion.    but all this good work is totally undone if the guests do not feel safe and that the management do not apply the duty of care when those guests step over their threshold too have a holiday on Sol Oasis property .    The food is average at bestbreakfast is repetitive and no new items really feature daily.White Wine is palatable Spanish justbeer is from Sagres in Portugalevery time we do All Inclusive I wonder why so this has definitely got it out of our system unless it’s unavoidable….we asked for compensation and Mdme ARIFI informed me that they did not breach their contract…….obviously safety of guests doesn’t come under that contract….enough said    Now Mdm ARIFI will reply to this review and probably give a totally different take or view on our experiencebut we have been totally honest and non biased in our review here of our holiday experienceone we hope we not need to experience again.

Review_Text: To re-iterate a recent review comment one of the criticisms of the hotel itself is the lack of basic information on arrival.    The complimentary shuttle is great. However as mentioned the bus drop off point is a fair way from the Main Square/Medina and you are not shown where to go.    What actually lets the hotel down in our opinion is in general the calibre of clientele.  Yes it’s an All Inclusive Hotel However not all guests wish to spend their time drinking copious amounts of alcohol from the minute the bar opens until closing time. It was extremely frustrating when going to the bar just to get a bottle of water or a coffee to have to wait in a long queue to be served whilst people were ordering in excess of four to six drinks each at an average of hourly intervals throughout the day. Neither is is particularly pleasant having to watch paraletic/intoxicated 20/30 year olds falling all over the place screaming and yelling to each other from one end of the hotel grounds to the other.    With regard to the all inclusive buffet apart from the ‘rancid’ butter mentioned in a review which explains why our rolls tasted like vomit (!) you would think some of the guests had been starved and food was in short supply! Running into the buffet grabbing endless plates of food then leaving lots to waste. Coupled with the inability to use tongs touching coughing and sneezing over the food we were not surprised to have fallen ill with a virus during our .    Finally picking up on a recent review I had a couple of items of clothing go missing from my room which could well have been taken in error when the bed was changed. We reported this to Guest Services and I would have expected with an in-house laundry that the items were found and returned to me. This was sadly not the case and leaves a bad taste.    In summary if you love to spend every day and night drinking yourself under the table  have a penchant for gluttonous behaviour and dont really care where in the world you are the Sol Oasis is the perfect hotel for you!

Review_Date: Jordan S wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Lovely hotel but lots of room for improvement
Review_Text: We wanted to have a half-term break with (hopefully some sun) that wasn't too far from the UK to travel with our 4 year old and 9 month year old. We also wanted somewhere all-inclusive but where we could have some adult time as well. Sol Oasis ticked all those boxes and the reviews were very positive. The reality however was somewhat disappointing.    First impressions count and on arrival there was no overview of the hotel or it's facilities no information shared about food times excursions layout drinks etc. We were also served welcome drinks (in the land of fresh oranges) which were more akin to Sunny Delight circa 1998. The hotel itself is beautiful the inside bar / lounge area is exactly as pictured.    We had requested a cot via email via the app (which they claimed didn't exist but actually had our booking and room number on it) via reception via call twice and in person. It eventually arrived 4 hours later. We had opted for the largest room and it was very spacious clean and tastefully decorated. It was cleaned impeccably every day.    There was a Nespresso machine but no pods. We requested these and someone arrived with some promptly as well as some drinks for the mini fridge and a selection of sweet treats. A nice touch or so we thought. They then returned 5 minutes later saying there was a mistake and swiftly took all of these out of the room. The coffee pods eventually arrived but when we requested more later in the week we were told these were now at an additional cost. So a coffee machine as standard in our room but the coffee was charged. This is a running theme across the hotel.    The hotel advertises 4 restaurants. Nowhere does it say that one of those is permanently closed the other is a paid for tapas restaurant which sits empty one is Moroccan and you can only go once (it's the same food as the buffet but in a restaurant setting) and then a themed restaurant. So ultimately it's one restaurant for the entire stay - breakfast lunch and dinner. The food was quantity over quality and none of it is hot. The potatoes are always undercooked and we experienced raw merguez sausages. It's all lukewarm (school dinners come to mind). The drinks are all sweetened the coffee is from a machine and all tastes like sweetened milk the wine was passable. The cocktails are woeful - they all taste of the same lemon washing-up liquid regardless of choice and served in dirty plastic cups. Any drink that might be served with some care is charged as extra.    The kids pool is never heated it's freezing and sat unused for the majority of our trip. The kids club and staff however are fantastic. It's open all day to drop in and out of and the staff work really hard to keep things fun.    There is a lot of "forced fun" as this hotel which some people might enjoy but we just wanted to relax and not take part in belly dancing or darts or the evening "entertainment".    We took the free shuttle bus into the center which is very useful but there's a pre-arranged scheme with the driver to drop you next to his friends a little out of the main area who are then all pushing and offering tours as soon as you step out of the bus.    We did raise our issues with management on day one as we do not like leaving reviews without the hotel having a chance to improve but unfortunately things remained consistently average.    Overall the kids had fun with the pool and made some friends but for us it was disappointing. The annoying thing is that this could be an incredible hotel and experience the children's setup and staff are amazing but it's let down by many details once you scratch away the nice aesthetic.

I saw a kids clubs but didn't use it as I didn't go with kids there's a gym tennis volleyball and table tennis area again I didn't make use of it.  One thing I didn't much like but plenty of people did and will was the cats roaming the hotel. I suppose as I'm not a pet person I just didn't like that much. Review_Text: I am writing to express our disgust with the Sol Oasis Melia Hotel. To such an extent we truncated our holiday and booked flights home. The hotel information is erroneous and falls well short of being a 4 star hotel .  The primary complaint is that the food was appalling:- overcooked vegetables fish and meat tough chicken burgers etc  food was served tepid and the general quality poor .  Surviving on bread rolls and butter only to find the pre packed butter was rancid .We were informed this did sometimes happen  although I have never experienced rancid butter being served in 50 years of travelling the planet .  We were led to believe there are 4 restaurants  the primary restaurant which is by any criteria a canteen is the only place one can eat . There are 2 other restaurants one was closed ( and one would have to pay anyway ) the other allowed 1 meal during the stay . Needless to say the food there was no better .  Enquiry into the location of the other restaurant only confirmed that there wasn’t one although there was a snack bar and a pizza oven ! The Safran and Cafe Maure are one and the same and we never saw any Spanish food .  The room was small and the wardrobe tiny viz. 2 small draws and 6 hangers  no facility to make a hot drink . The bathroom had mould growing up the walls in the shower and the basin plug was faulty and drained slowly .

Review_Date: Gillian E wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: My sister two friends and I returned last night from 5 days away at this hotel.  The staff and hotel were excellent. The reception and check in was quick and the reception staff very helpful.  Entertainment was great and we found that Sam organised sessions where you could be taught how to cook certain dishes or types of bread. Shows and entertainment during day and evening. They all worked so hard.    There was a wide variety of food available something for everyone. There was another restaurant on site which is free but you have to book and we found the food was good enough in the restaurant. I thought I wouldn’t like the wine but did. Staff were quite happy to put my tea in a ‘pot’ rather than a cup. Clean and efficient. Buffet style but no queues as food well spread out.    Bar closed at 11 pm but we just made sure we had some extra glasses.  We didn’t use the spa but you can use the indoor pool if you have a treatment.    If you want anything just ask rooms clean and best shower ever. Staff were so pleasant.    Free shuttle into Marrakech throughout the day. We went on the shuttle but came back in a taxi. That was an experience.    There were only a couple of things that could have made it better which are so simple.. a kettle in the room (there apparently were in the larger rooms) a booklet telling you all the activities that are on site times restaurant was open (there is also a snack bar open most of the day) how to get your pool towels and where and a reminder of all the things they tell you when you arrive. You forget so easily what they have to offer. My bed was so comfortable.    I would certainly go back to this lovely hotel. It has so many extras and if anyone asks I would send them here.

Review_Date: AHlondon wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: If there were an option to give 4.5/5 I would do so thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.    The excellent reviews are entirely justified.  The ground/cleaning staff work tirelessly so the place is spotless.  The animation team are a bundle of infectious energy getting to know all the guests by name but are happy to leave you alone too. Sam is a real asset and the quality of the entertainment is good.  The newly opened Spa was a wonderful surprise. We had Hammam treatments and massages - really good value at 60 euros for 60 minutes and the treatments were incredible. You can use the indoor pool before and after treatments which was lovely.  Food was excellent for an AI buffet lots of local cuisine and a fresh cooked station for pasta meat and fish. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. We ate at the Moroccan restaurant but to be honest we preferred the buffet.  The rooms look just like they do in the photos we had a lovely little balcony - so ask for one of those if you can.  There is an agent on site to book trips with who was really helpful and we negotiated a really good value trip into the city with a private driver and guide. Highly recommend Rashid as a guide.    The reason I don't give it 5 stars?  I would have liked drinks to be served to you at dinner instead of having to serve yourself water and wine. The cocktails were not great. Drinkable but I would not have paid for them. The indoor bar was better than the pool bar. Poolside drinks service would have been nice as there was usually quite a wait at the bar and this was with the hotel at very low capacity    I would absolutely return to this hotel - excellent value for money for some winter sun.

The free shuttle is also an excellent service into Marrakech as private taxis would be fairly expensive. We are already planning our next visit to the sol oasis for late 2023.

Review_Date: SmileyBean wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Possibly the best place to stay near Marrakech
Review_Text: Everything about this small resort is almost perfect. Although I found a few small niggles such as some of the hot food on the buffet actually being lukewarm the friendliness of the staff and the whole atmosphere of care and quality more than make up for them.  I have to admit never having been to an all inclusive resort before but having spoken to several others who have as well as travelers in Marrakech staying at other resorts I think we were extremely lucky in our choice of what has turned out to be a fantastic place.  There is food and drink available all day until 11 pm great entertainment all day and into the evening and a lovely selection of places to chill including heaters and fire pits in the terrace on cooler evenings.  The pool is warm (27 Deg) with a separate kids pool and play area and there are a range of other activities available like football basket ball archery and table tennis.  Although a 20 to 30 minute drive from the city there is a free regular mini bus as well as a rep with a selection of excursions in the foyer.  I doubt this will be the last time we stay here.

Review_Date: May wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: I had an overall very relaxing getaway at this all inclusive resort. What initially drew me in were the gardens greenery photos of the suites and community areas. I wanted to stay somewhere that really captured Moroccan style decor and ambience. Checking in was pretty quick. the receptionist was friendly and helpful. An issue immediately arose when I noticed my suite did not have a balcony attached. The receptionist was able to resolve this discrepancy quickly and placed us in a room with a balcony view. Once settled in our room we were immediately looking for food or something to snack on. One of my cons was that room service came with an extra charge/service fee; which is unlike my experience at other all inclusive resorts. There was a variety of finger foods outside by their outdoor bar but there wasn’t a proper barrier or method to keep flies away. Breakfast lunch and dinner was served in a common hall à la cart style. they had a large variety and essentially something in there for everyone. breakfast however was my least favorite. There wasn’t much variety. I got to a point where I didn’t even wake up for breakfast. also the Moroccan restaurant on ground that requires a reservation is essentially the same food as the common hall for other meals. The spa I was under renovation when we arrived but thankfully opened before our departure. I enjoyed a spa day before I left and it was the highlight of my stay. The pool was large and nice but I wish it were warmer. The weather during my stay was no higher than 75 Fahrenheit. I think this resort is perfect for families as there were a handful of children during my stay. The resort staff also did a perfect job catering to Christmas holiday decor festivities and meals. All in all my first visit to morocco was a success. More highlights from this trip can be found on my IG @wherezmay

Review_Date: Fiona M wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: We have just returned from the Sol Oasis for a New Years break and loved every minute (28th December - 12 January). A desert paradise. It's such a relaxing and beautiful place. NYE party was amazing with lots of entertainment - live bands belly dancers fire eaters DJ disco plus gala dinner cocktails etc the hotel went over and above to make the night special.  The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms are lovely. There are 3 heated pools (one in spa) with lots of loungers and additional deck chairs under trees etc.  The food is plentiful and delicious with multiple tagine options pasta station salad meat desserts and international themed nights (Italian Oriental Mexican to name a few).  ALL the staff are absolutely AMAZING so friendly and went out their way to make our holiday special a HUGE asset for the hotel. The Bar staff were brilliant remembering your drinks no matter what time of day it was however the true gem was Mohsine he was always full of smiles. The Animation/Entertainment team WOW. They worked really hard providing things to do through the day - darts tagine cookery demos aerobics etc and the shows at night were FANTASTIC. The jewel has to be Sam he kept up entertained (Mr McGregor says Hi ) but a HUGE shout out the rest of the team Russ and his beautiful wife Sousou Mike (aka Michael Jackson) Abdel and not forgetting Fatima (keep going with the scottish lingo!). The best entertainment I've had in a hotel for a long time - well done everyone!!.  There is a free shuttle running multiple times through the day will take you into Marrakech and pick you up after. Also you may wish to book trips from Hotel Hicham was very helpful.  You will not be disappointed with this desert gem we had a fantastic time and would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was out first time in Marrakesh and so glad Sol Oasis made it special. We will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mass J H wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Simply perfect - we will be back. Again and again.
Review_Text: We are in the Luxury hospitality industry so when we say Wow. We mean WOW. Sol Oasis is literally that. A paradise oasis in constant sunshine. We have escaped the UK winter- currently 2 celcius- and even at the height of Moroccan winter we have eternal blue skies with 26 degrees of glorious African sun. The 3 swimming pools are heated and oh so perfectly laid out around the food and beverage offering.  The food offering is astronomical and the flavours of Moroccan traditional cooking are delicately sewn into every dish with enough choice to please even the most conservative palatte.  The real jewels in the crown of this Dessert Paradise are the staff. They make British hospitality look stupid. The owners should be proud. I wish I could name each and every one. Their constant smiles and ability to anticipate your needs before even you can are second to none. I will name just a humble few but the entire compliment of staff are on another level. Fatima in the Entertainment team is the most epic asset along side are Sousou Russ Sam Mike Abdel and Waheba who are beyond epic. The Bar staff - Mochine and crew will serve mixology magic with a smile. FOH and waitering teams in the restaurant including Abdelilah and Zacheria serve to a standard we dont see in the UK unless your paying Michellin prices. The cleaning and housekeeping  staff keep this place spotless. If you are deciding on a place to stay in Morrocco - your search is over. There may be no beach but the Atlantic here is freezing year round so dont look at that as a benefit. Visit Sol Oasis. You can thank me later.

The Games: Lots of action with Tennis Volleyball Football Zumba Gym!    We loved our 7 days every single moment. I on behalf of all our families thank Loveholidays Sol WM events the staff and the local friendly and extremely hospitable Moroccan people who provide high quality and personable services.    We will be back! A BIG thank you to all.

Review_Date: Wayne Norris wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Pros:  - Excellent food and drinks- best selection I've ever seen at an all inclusive  - Room good and was cleaned every day  - Shuttle bus runs frequently throughout the day and drops at a good location  - Sports gym and other facilities really good  - Most staff members were pleasant and helpful. A bit of variety and less volume would be best for this type of audience.  - Entertainment staff were energetic great to the kids and helpful. I admire their daily positively. However they were trying to get me to dance every night. Look I'm no stranger to the dancefloor but "forced fun" is not my thing. People have different interests even in a holiday environment.    Overall this is a great hotel and I would come back to stay. Just take it easy on me next time. All the best.

Review_Date: Rowhana B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We stayed in Dec 2022. Temperature was 20 degrees average. Its cold in the mornings before midday so you will need warm clothes.    Our main issue and the reason why I've rated this hotel 2 stars is because of the cats. Stray cats are constantly in the buffet restaurant. The doors are left open and guests also bring them in. The French guests in particular liked them. But they should not be in the dining room so unhygienic. They were climbing on the tables and sofas. We kept jumping out of our seats as they ran under our feet. The staff did not care. I complained many times and nobody seemed to care. What if someone was allergic to cats? Well if you are this is not the place for you. I also complained to the general manager and he promised it would be fixed the next day still nothing. Guest experience manager Hajar told me nothing could be done as most of the guests like the cats. I told her to print notices for the doors so guests know not to bring in the cats she said she had printed them we didn't see anything during our stay so I'm guessing this was a lie. So basically they don't care about the 10% only the 90% who are French or locals. Other (UK) guests were also uncomfortable.    Anwyay our whole experience was ruined by these cats and the hotel's total disregard about the issue. The food was nice but what's the point when you cannot sit and eat in peace? One day in a fit of rage I had to take food back to my room as I couldn't stand it anymore.    During check out our 1 year old got quite ill we asked for the nurse to come who was useless couldn't speak English and took our daughters temperature in the most bizarre way. We waited for a doctor who never came. So if you're travelling with toddlers or elderly beware that you will be helpless in an emergency.    Our bathroom was also full of flies. I've uploaded a video. The cleaners just had to spray the vents which would have resolved the issue. We waited 2 days a can of bug spray was left in our room for us to do this ourselves but was taken back the next day.    We were on ground floor and the floor was full of ants. Don't know why nothing was ever done about this.    We asked for a cot to be in the room but it wasn't so had to ask again and when it arrived it was broken.    Most staff are nice but some reception staff are rude and lazy. They need to be more proactive.    Tour guide Mr Higham (Mr Hisham) will fleece you and keep the money for himself. Don't buy anything from him. He will over-sell.    Even though there is a free shuttle bus to the centre it takes 30 mins and doesn't quite drop you in the center. Timings are also not great.    This hotel does need to make improvements. It's not a 4 star hotel. I was very happy to be leaving and even paid a taxi driver extra to leave earlier as I couldn't stand another meal being attacked by cats!

Review_Date: Morpeth69 wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at the end of November on an all inclusive package for one week.    We had great weather most of the time - hot enough to lounge by the pool all day and then cool enough in the evening to enjoy the fire pits in the outside bar area.    The hotel is about 20 mins outside of Marrakech - the hotel provide a free shuttle throughout the day.    The hotel has a lovely relaxed atmosphere - all the staff (bar dining room reception entertainments) are super helpful and friendly. Sometimes in all inclusive resorts the bars can be mean but here the beer wine and cocktails flow!    The rooms are modern with everything you would expect (safe fridge nice shower etc) and housekeeping do a great job - like magic fairies tidying up our mess every day.    The food is plentiful and there is a lot of choice - quite a meat based set of options. Not haut cuisine but you won't go hungry. There is hardly an hour of the day when food isn't available - snacks in the afternoon are a nice touch.    If you like fitness and activities there are plenty of options - nice gym yoga space tennis court volley ball court pool tables. I had the facility to myself each time I used it. The pool is particularly nice.    The entertainments team are very enthusiastic and try to involve everyone. Its not my thing but plenty of people enjoyed games (bingo karaoke etc) and performances in the evening.    We were here during the World Cup - big screens available for all matches!    There is a rep onsite offering day trips. The hot air balloon ride was a truly memorable experience - everything from having coffee by the fire before the sun rose as the balloons were readied right through to the landing was unbeatable and a genuinely once in a life time experience. You really get what you pay for! We also booked the city tour - which I would not recommend. Shepherded from one shop to another and gently pressured into buying. We had a better time doing our own walking tour using a guide book!    So all in all - would really recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: lizaadamssmith wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: My husband and I visited this resort for one week. It was a fusion of authentic Moroccan hospitality combined with modern high standards and it should have a 5 star rating. All the positive comments are true. The staff cannot do enough to enhance guests' experience. We arrived late at night and the reception arranged for some food to be delivered to our room. I feel that this resort review all the feedback and then implement changes to keep evolving their service.  The room was clean and pleasant. The restaurant was fantastic with a wide diversity of fresh food. The salads were very exciting and totally safe so obviously washed in bottled water. Mohammed and all the waiting team were friendly and helpful. Mohcine and all the bar staff provided exemplary service at the pool and Cactus bars. Ice is safe.  The animation team were extremely hard working and tried to make everyone welcome.  The Cafe Maure was a fantastic experience.  The shuttle bus regularly drops off guests to the Hotel de Ville area in Marrakesh so the isolated location of this resort is not an issue.  There are some flies occasionally which can be a bit annoying.  The only suggestion that I can make would be that the reception has more change so that we can have smaller notes to provide reasonable tips to the staff.  We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this resort to all. So thank you so much to all the staff including the gardeners and cleaners for an exceptional experience

Review_Date: Lindsay C wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Had a lovely week in the Sol Oasis Marrakech. The hotel is clean staff are friendly & efficient and the food was great. Our room was small but perfect for what we needed.  We arrived late on our first night but with plenty of reception staff on duty check in was efficient and painless.  There are plenty of activities to participate in during the day if you want to get involved in them (coordinated by the animation team) but if not the pool and loungers are immaculate so perfect for relaxing in the sun. You can also use the activities equipment at any time yourself. The pool staff were always quick to help with loungers or umbrellas nothing was too much trouble.  There is free shuttle bus into the city which needs booked in advance at reception but runs regularly and takes about 25 minutes.  Meals were served as a buffet and there was always plenty on offer my personal favourite was the tagine (every single one of them). There is a traditional Moroccan restaurant where you can have one meal which is included in the all inclusive price again the food here was excellent. The Kass bar and pool bar serve the same drinks but it was nice to have a choice of bar to sit at/in.  The evening entertainment started off with two guitarists/singers who were wonderful it was so lovely to sit listening to them then it was over to the animation team for signing dancing and lots of giggles. The animation team all came across as genuine fun people who want to make your holiday enjoyable and forever had a smile on their faces a big shout out to Sam Rada Russ Fatima Abdul and everyone else in the team whose name I didn't catch.  Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to combine a relaxing pool holiday with the vibrant city or Marrakech and we we enjoyed it so much we are seriously considering booking again for next year.

Review_Date: Karen B wrote a review Nov 2022

Review_Text: Comfortable room good shower toiletries provided room tidied every day. Beautiful hotel. Excellent food. Engaging and friendly entertainment team. Friendly staff all round. Few tips and specific mentions. There is a shuttle to and from centre of Marrakesh you must book ahead as it’s well utilised. Food is varied and great quality always different tagines to try. Entertainment team are excellent. Reda (coach)for yoga and aqua aerobics and humour. Russ we first noticed Russ at bingo night with his infectious smile and giggle we soon learned that Russ was an excellent dancer and front man in the Bollywood show. Abdul is a ray of sunlight constantly smiling and so full of energy just watching him be so happy made us smile every day. Miko we noticed half way through the week when he danced his way through EVERYTHING gorgeous smile too. Sam where do we start with Sam the man who can do everything. Welcomed us on day one with a dance lesson alway checking in with us and inviting us to take part in activities. He kept everything running and organised lost count of how many languages he can speak. He took time out on our last day to teach us French boules. All of them were friendly and we would often just sit back and observe they are very caring and great with the young kids. The staff around the pool were attentive always rushing over to help with umbrellas. Sunbed towels are changed every day give a deposit at start of week for a card and swap daily at hut next to pool. Reception staff helpful and happy to print out boarding pass which was required at airport. Spa at hotel is being renovated but we went for a traditional hamman and massage prepare to be stripped and have a thorough experience! Evening entertainment at hotel; there is a guitar duo who play most nights they are brilliant. We had a fantastic week. A mix of taking part and relaxing it will be what you make it.

Review_Date: Jessica P wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Don’t let the 5 star reviews mislead you!
Review_Text: After reading all of the 5 star amazing reviews I thought this place was too good to be true!    IT IS all the 5 star reviews mention the animation team and not much else. Don’t get me wrong the animation team are great if you want to join in but if that’s not your thing then they can be quite full on!    However they work very hard start early in the morning and finish late at night and everyone always had a smile on their face! So I take my hats off to them.    The hotel itself is very clean however the rooms are small ours didn’t have anywhere to dry our wet clothes which was annoying!    The food at the hotel was the worst food I’ve ever eaten in my life. Bland cold and boring. Some nights we didn’t even eat as the buffet was awful. The only saving grace is they have fresh pizza cooked how you like every night. But pizza gets boring after a while.    We booked the Spanish tapas restaurant one night we arrived at our booked time and waited 20 minutes for the waiter to bring us menus we were then told that we had to wait another 20 minutes before we could order food. He told us the manager was coming down to talk to us we waited 15 minutes before we left. We passed the manager he did try and get us to go back but at this point we had waited so long we just needed to eat. You have to pay extra for the tapas so you think they would be encouraging more guests to use it and have better service. Most of the time it sits empty.    The hotel itself is lovely and so are the staff the food however really let’s this hotel down.

Review_Date: Emma R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: The positives: The hotel is spotlessly clean and is well furnished in the communal areas. Our room was well set up with a very comfortable bed and nice bedding. The bathroom had a hairdryer that was powerful and the shower was excellent. The two acoustic singers by the bar in the evenings were very good. The free shuttle service into Marrakech was great.    The negatives: The bathroom door is a swing type so has a gap where they meet so not quite as private as a bathroom should be.    Food was at best average. You get one night (without a surcharge) at the restaurant and the rest of the time you have to eat in the buffet restaurant where the food is ok but flies are flying around the food and the hot food wasn’t very hot . The one night we had at the restaurant my meal was pleasant enough but my husbands was in his words 'the worst he has ever had' with other people around us complaining about their food being cold. The waiter was however very nice and there was a nice atmosphere to the place.    So many reviews go to town on how wonderful the animation team are we actually found them too full-on and extremely irritating and actually disingenuous. They were constantly coming over whilst we were laying by the pool and asking us to join in the games (water volleyball darts table-tennis belly dancing etc) which we said we're just not interested in but we were asked every day about 5 times a day and made to feel bad for not joining in. On one of the days my husband and I were on our loungers he was lying there with his eyes closed when one of the female animation team came over and stroked his foot to wake him up and ask him if he wanted to join in one of the games!! This same person collared us one evening at the bar sat herself down (without asking) and helped herself to our snacks and then tried to force me to go on to my phone and write a 5 star review. I refused she became quite insistent trying to make me do it I stuck my heels in and said no.    I have to say though that the animation team do work very hard they are there from morning to night and I’m sure lots of people enjoy them but sorry just not for us.    If you're after a relaxing quiet holiday this place is not for you. The music is on throughout the day right by the pool where people are trying to relax read books listen to podcasts etc and it is blasted so loudly that the speakers were actually making the music sound distorted. We've been on plenty of holidays where there's music by the pool and it’s great but at full blast it's just not enjoyable. We felt it is trying to be an 18-30's holiday but even the younger guests mentioned to us that they found the music ridiculously loud. There are also a lot of conferences which take place here with hordes of people and they have their own music near to the pool so you have the pool music and the conference music fighting each other it really was unbelievable!    On the Saturday night the music by the bar went on until 2am and it was so loud! We also couldn't understand why the staff had moved all the sun loungers onto the grass and then at about 4am they were all moved back making the most hideous scrapping noise which went on for ages.    in conclusion if you are up for lots of games late nights and want to join in then you'd probably enjoy it here - for us it was all too much as we wanted to have a chilled out holiday but felt we needed a holiday to recover from this one!

Review_Date: Mouhab M wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Just returned from a 2 week stay at Sol Oasis Marrakech with my partner and family. We were there end of October to the start of November and the weather was so hot.    On arrival you walk through a beautiful archway with a stunning walkway to reception.    Reception staff were friendly and helpful and got us checked in quickly.    We were taken to our rooms and luggage arrived by trolley so we didn’t have to carry them to our room ourselves which was good and not like some other resorts. The rooms were beautiful and colourful and always kept clean. We were in room 1706 and our house keeping lady was outstanding (sorry forgot her name).    For all inclusive the food selection was impressive and very fresh and had a lot of various cuisine. There is a pasta station inside the restaurant and log burner for cooking fresh pizza outside the restaurant which is absolutely amazing! Big thanks to Rachadi the head chef and Jamal for the delicious food.    The bar and waiter service was exceptional and very hard working guys. They always remembered what we liked to drink and they have a big range of cocktails/mocktails. The alcohol is of good quality. Big thanks to Mohssin  Bira Nordine Toufik Redwane and not to forget Nizar who went above and beyond.    There is 2 separate restaurants within the hotel aswell as the all inclusive which are the Moroccan restaurant and a Tapas restaurant. We had a meal in the Moroccan restaurant and the food was absolutely gorgeous. Special thanks to Abdelilah/Orika.    The pool area had plenty of Sun loungers for everyone. The pool was a good size and never felt crowded. It was a nice place to relax and wasn’t too noisy.    The entertainment team all worked well together and had great enthusiasm. You could see they all loved what they do especially during their evening shows their happiness spilled out of them. There is a lot of day time activities throughout the day to take part in if you want to they don’t push you into them unlike other hotels. We were there over Halloween and the Halloween show was outstanding! Big thanks to Sam Dounia Russ Sousou Mike Khalid Khredala Niako Wahiba and the FRAM team. Also massive thank you to Houccine the main man in charge of this fabulous team.    Overall thank you so much for an incredible 2 week holiday. We will definitely be coming back and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: tazzyjay wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Just shy of Excellent an amazing experience x
Review_Text: This review does deserve excellent but a few minor points meant I had to give this very good instead of excellent .. we arrived on the 31st October for a 7 Nights Stay . A hotel with class and some of the best staff that can be found I have ever come across absolutely an amazing hotel. The room was beautiful but because we had our son staying with us the sofa could have been better quality we had to ask a few times to get the adjustments correct but we got there in the end we were staying all inclusive so it can be a hit and miss .  Restaurant times were breakfast 7till 10.30. Breakfast was 12 pm till 3pm And dinner 7.30 till 10pm if I remember correctly with afternoon snacks between 4 and 6 pm . Plenty of drinks at the various pool bar and quite bar . Fridge in your room with kettle . Plenty of towels and toiletry. You need to pay 100 dirham for your pool towel there are three pools but the indoor pool and spa was closed there was some work going on but the hotel is set in a beautiful scene. There are plenty of things to do and evening entertainment and dayteam are the best I have ever come across Michael aka michael Jackson and the whole team were so so friendly and amazing. Like I said this got very good and not excellent mainly due to the food but that is from our personal preferences nothing to do with variety of fresh juices salads and fresh fresh fruit which was plentiful brilliant chefs and amazing hot food just not all to our personal liking but there was so much food god only knows what they did with the left overs food cooked in front of you you must be very clear with everyone what you want most staff speak very good English the hotel would be very hard pushed to beaten and I am not one to mince my words I had seen many good reviews but I wanted to check it and review it myself the had a free one meal at Moroccan restaurant which we were not told about and some of the other holiday makers felt some info was given in preference to the customers who were regulars at the hotel I found everyone easy to get on with reception very very efficient again this is my personal experience I found as a family we had a really good time at this particular hotel and the staff were very helpful …. BIG QUESTION WOULD WE GO BACK AGAIN yes but half board only as all inclusive is only for the people who will stay stuck at the hotel … we did venture out on excursions and took the free shuttle bus few times into the centre of Marrakech.  I could go on forever but I think I have said what I could just a note on the excursions please make sure if your older in your fifties wear appropriate shoes ie trains with grip for some of the excursions .. prod the rep Hiram and ask away everything was very very very good but just shy of excellent x thank you everyone at the Sol Oasis for making our stay as best as you could …

Review_Date: Travellingteacher78 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Just returned from a five night holiday at the Sol Oasis Marrakech and we were overall impressed with our stay.    Room  Our room contained a large double bed and an armchair that converted into a single bed. Space was a little tight when the single bed was out but it was fine for a short stay. Great air-con decent shower comfortable beds a safe and a good sized fridge for keeping water cold. Wardrobe space is a little limited especially if three people are sharing. We also asked repeatedly for a third towel and water glass but never got them.    Food  Buffet breakfasts lunches and evening meals were outstanding. A really great selection of dishes to choose from - genuinely something for everyone. Hot food piping hot and cold food well-chilled. Very very well run part of the hotel - all staff totally on the ball.    Swimming pool  Swimming pool is a really great size for having a good swim and big enough that it never felt over-crowded. The water feels a little cold when you first get in but you soon get used to it. Plenty of sun beds some in direct sun for the whole day others more shaded. We always got a good spot without having to reserve beds at the crack of dawn. Children’s play pool looked amazing for younger guests.    Pool bar  In spite of there only being one or two staff service was always quick and with good humour and a smile. The quality of drinks on the all inclusive package weren’t great and I suspect the beer and wine to be low-alcohol versions. The cocktails were mostly all basic one spirit (single measure) and mixer (lots of juice or fizzy pop) so to my mind not really cocktails but I appreciate that good cocktails are much more time-consuming to mix something that’s not really possible in a busy all inclusive environment.    Grounds  The grounds are really beautifully well-maintained with some lovely planting. There are lots of places to sit in comfort (shaded or sunny) chill out and read a book or have a game of cards. What would make things even better is more regular clearing and cleaning of tables in the bar area. It wasn’t uncommon to see sticky tables and half finished food and drinks left for several hours which certainly accounts for the huge number of flies in that area of the hotel.    Entertainment  The animation team are a great bunch of people and their enthusiasm is infectious. We enjoyed getting involved in some activities such as aqua aerobics darts games in and around the pool and The Squid Game evening but we opted out of other things and nobody was ever overly pushy. We didn’t go to any of the evening shows as we preferred rounding off the evening having a quiet drink and a game of cards in the gorgeously designed and decorated indoor bar.

Review_Date: Connector06713739417 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: On arrival at the Sol Oasis you are greeted by a beautiful picturesque building.  Check in was short and sweet (with no real information about what was what!) and we presume as we arrived at midnight all the welcome cocktails had been cleared away.  The key cards didn't arrive when we got to the room. The porter let us in and said he would return quickly with new cards. You will find not a lot happens quickly! The staff are very helpful but seem to always have more than 1 conversation on the go so you don't know if they are dealing with you or not?  We were tired and Hungry so ordered room service. Food arrived hot  was tasty and reasonably priced.  The next day we wandered around the grounds and hotel familiarising ourselves with what was where. The hotel and grounds are spotless as was our room.  You have to give a deposit for the pool towel at reception. 100 Derhams each. You can change as often as you want.  The pool is clean  large but somewhat noisy. Plenty of beds and umbrellas.  The pool bar plenty of drinks cocktails and water available. The cocktails are a bit hit and miss as they run out of a spirit and just substitute with another. A Mojito does not taste the same with Gin!  There is a kitchen that opens mid afternoon but be quick as they do not replenish the snacks once gone  The Kasbah. This bar is more refined with better cocktails and real glasses. Somewhere less noisy to sit.  The food hall quantity takes over from quality sadly. We found the food rather bland. More than edible but we had been looking forward to traditional salads and couscous.  The room. Clean large bed and tv. Shower was more than adequate and the soaps etc were fine. Towels and bedding changed daily.  The show. We watched about half an hour of the show one night and decide it wasn't for us but could see a lot of effort had gone into it.  Overall it's a nice place to come for a week. Shuttle bus takes you into Marrakech for free. It's well worth the trip. Don't use your phone as its very expensive!

Review_Title: Oasis outside of Marrakech, but quite a trek outside of the city
Review_Text: Good clean hotel an oasis outside of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. Food is buffet-style with the exception of a couple of restaurants. The bar area overlooks the pool and there is live music every night.    The downside is that it is really in the middle of nowhere you can't go out of the resort for a walk it's all desert. There is a free shuttle into Marrakech but it only holds 15 to 20 people has to be pre- booked and is not that frequent (eg just 3 buses in the morning). And the return bus either comes back at 4pm which is too early or 9pm which is too late. The alternative is taxi at EUR20 each way.    Other not so good aspects: the food is fairly average more canteen-style. We ate better everywhere outside of the hotel. And the live music doesn't stop till 11pm and can be heard throughout the resort so early nights are difficult!

Review_Date: SAEED D wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Four Old Men In Search Of An Oasis?
Review_Text: We four brothers all well over into our seventies have been looking for a suitable hotel to celebrate our second holiday together. Fussy choosey and hard to please it was not easy to select our" Perfect Shangri-La"!    After some diligent search by the two of us we zeroed in on a rather appropriately named 'Sol Oases' hotel in Marrakesh Morocco.    Located at the outer rim of Marrakesh it took about 20 minutes to reach the hotel. from the Menara airport. Although dark by the time we reached our chosen 'Shangri-La' One unmistakable impression we were given was the startling resemblance to the world-famous Court Of The Lions building in Granada Spain. It is beautiful and oh so very tranquil! A quality that is unmissable even in the gathering darkness.    The rooms were rather small and there were no bathrobes nor any slippers. Only one 1.5 litre of water bottle of spring water a day was allocated.    On the positive side the breakfast in the morning was lavish with lots of variety and all food seemed freshly prepared and carefully selected. With not so many guests around we served ourselves without being pushed around and had ample time to pick and chose our food. Here too we met some outstanding unsung heroes who are found in many of hotels throughout the world. They are the people who tirelessly work silently to enhance the popularity and reputation of a hotel.    Nabil who was in charge of the workings at the dining hall was one of those strong silent types. He was approachable with ready smile and a positive response to all and any request you come with. No wonder he was surrounded by many appreciating guests.    Here too we met Naoval. A bubbly effervescent smiling and bespectacled energy powerhouse of s woman! Want anything or want to have anything done? Naoval is the one to it...with a smile.    As I was drifting around looking for a tasty morsel or two La Hassan beckoned me on. I soon fell to the charm and delicious pasta and sauce of this large smiling man. This lasted throughout our stay at the place.    Earlier at the reception hard-working and obliging Ilyas and Haitam behind the reception counter and Rashid in front of the counter made their presence felt by being so very obliging. They all went beyond the call of duty to help.    Last but not least I must mention one of the LEAST noticed and very little appreciated women. Not recognized or noticed but Zohra is an extremely vital part of the entire workings of Sol Oases. Quietly but very efficiently she works tirelessly in keeping the rooms immaculately clean and tidy.    All in all Sol Oases is a great hotel to rest in.    Azeem Diwan

It's not the biggest resort it doesn't necessarily have the best facilities it's a few miles from town the bars close at 11pm etc yet somehow it conquers all these disadvantages to deliver the perfect holiday experience whether you're 6 or 61 (me). Very wide selection at all meal times mainly but not exclusively Moroccan. Pizza chicken nuggets and chips also available. The beautiful crusty bread at all mealtimes also deserves a mention. Thanks to the Head Chef and his team for their hard work all week and to Nebil and his dining room team for fetching carrying and regular topping up of my wine glass!    Last but not least the bar team work so hard outside in the pool bar all day and into the evening delivering fizzy pop for the kids or cold beers and sophisticated cocktails for the grown ups unflustered and always smiling even on the hottest of days. Thank you Jafar Bira and Nourdane.    Great teams at work in all departments are a sign of good management keep it up Sol Oasis.

Review_Date: John Donagh wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: An Amazing family holiday that we will not forget
Review_Text: We visited Sol Oasis Marrakesh at the end of August 2022.  It had been our first family sun holiday since pre Covid and our first time to Marrakesh.  We booked a Family Extra Suite and it was perfect King bed in main bedroom and a pull out Sofa Bed in living area which was very comfortable with a nice big bathroom terrace and balcony area also wardrobe safe coffee making facilities and 2 x air con units which keep the room at the perfect temperature.  House keeping called daily and changed bed linen and towels and room was cleaned to a very high standard. The hotel and grounds are kept in immaculate condition there are a couple of different bar areas but we mainly used bar area by pool as that was where all the entertainment was.  The All inclusive food selection was to a very good standard we have a couple of picky eaters and they were happy with selection for breakfast lunch and dinner. There is also an outdoor pizza and burger area which are available at lunch and evening time.  The staff were amazing from reception house keeping waiting bar staff and animation team all were so friendly and would go out of their way to make sure you were happy. Special mention to Hassan in dining area and all the animation crew SouSou ZiSou Russ Mike Sam Moss they absolutely made our holiday so much fun and gave us plenty of information on what to do and where to go in Marrakesh.  The staff are a credit to the Hotel and made for a truly memorable holiday.  We had great fun dancing and watching the fantastic shows that the team put so much effort into every second evening. There were also games during the day at the pool and around the area that you could easily join in with watch but were unintrusive if you just wanted to chill.    The location of the hotel is about 20 mins in a taxi outside the main area of Marrakesh we enjoyed this but the cost of a taxi in about €20 each way (approx.) The hotel did run a free shuttle bus but best to book in advance and also get your timing right you could end up having to get a taxi back if there was too much time between drop off and pick up.    We would most definitely visit Sol Oasis again due to the amazing vibe in the hotel and of course the world class animation team who really could not do enough for us. The people we met in Marrakesh were also extremely friendly and left us with very fond memories of Morrocco.

Review_Date: Leanne G wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Great break, looking forward to coming back
Review_Text: We travelled to Sol Oasis on a 7-day getaway with the aim to have a relaxing holiday and explore Marrakesh; which we did - sort of.    The hotel itself is very “Instagrammable” with lovely architecture and lighting throughout but the real life of the hotel comes from the entertainment team - especially Mousse SouSou and Sam.    With games throughout the day we found ourselves leaving the hotel less than we intended to so we could stick around for water-sports the odd pool game and some of the activities on site.    We met some amazing people out there too who we plan to keep in touch with and come back to Sol Oasis for a reunion but until then here’s what we loved and we’d recommend…    WHAT WE LOVED…    - The people super friendly guests and hotel staff    - Water polo in the pool (and winning!)    - Number of guests  (not too many but enough to have a great atmosphere)    - Lunch time selection / snacks    - Bar-side drinks that allowed you to skip the queues    - Free shuttle bus service to the market / town    WHAT WE WOULD RECOMMEND…    - Late-opening for the pool / evening pool parties    - More outside entertainment in the evening    - More thorough clean of hotel rooms    - Later room towel collection    - Wider variety of pool games i.e. volleyball tournaments water obstacles etc.    - Later bar opening hours    - Raise awareness of cats roaming around the grounds (especially as my boyfriend is allergic to them!)

Review_Date: denice h wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Just returned from a week at Sol Oasis. Had a lovely relaxing time. The grounds are spotless and great ambiance especially the live music at night. The food choice was extensive some of the desserts were amazing it was clear a lot of work and planning goes into the food preparation appearance and choice. The only thing we would of changed is that it was not always hot more warm however we did notice a microwave towards the end of the week which we probably could of used.  Special shout out to the entertainment staff who are really friendly and engaging however I think the unsung hero's are the waiting and the cleaning staff who work quietly behind the scenes making sure everything runs smoothly. Thanks to the bartender in the inside bar she is a lovely friendly person. Also the bartender/supervisor on the outside bar who works so hard making sure everyone gets their drinks and always has a smile on his face. I saw some negative reviews about the reception staff on TripAdvisor however our experience was that the reception staff were polite full of information and happy to make sure you had what you needed.  We had a day out in the souk - piece of advice don't take up the tour guide just make sure you know where you need to get back to and head for the tallest mosque don't be afraid to say 'no' to the traders some of their prices are outrageous.  Only slight disappointment was that I presumed when booking that all rooms had a balcony they don't and those that do look like quite small balconies however as the grounds are so lovely it wasn't a big deal. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in our room however you don't really need them and some rooms seem to have them.  Would we return Morocco definitely would we return to Sol Oasis probably.
