Review_Date: Natalie S wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: A wonderful stay…. Thank you to the best team!
Review_Text: Stayed 18th Aug for 10 days. We had a great stay….    Firstly! The excellent!    The animation team… I’d read the reviews before we went but even then they exceeded expectations! They are the most amazing gang! We were stunned when we were called by our names on the first morning and the engagement was great with our son and always up for a chat and a laugh! Everyone was wonderful but special mention to our star Niako Sam Moose Russ! And many more names we’ve forgotten! (Sorry guys!) they all work so hard and make the hotel! We especially loved the Coba cabana and pool party! Such great fun!    Bar: lovely friendly staff! Mojitos we’re spot on! Occasional queues in afternoon could be easily solved by free vend in soft drinks for children…    Restaurant: self service restaurant tasty food and lot of choice- helpful staff. What lets it down is labelling whilst most of the main courses have labels there are no basic descriptions / ingredients. This is worse with the salad bar sadly no labelling at all. (We’ve previously stayed in a hotel with a simple app / QR code that provided daily menus- was really useful!)  Lunchtime BBQ’s are wonderful and our son was delighted with candy floss!    Room: we had the Sol basic room for 2 adults / 1 child. On check in we asked why there wasn’t a terrace (on website room images have terrace) I mentioned that the room with a pull out bed was very small and with no terrace restrictive. We ended up folding up the pull out bed over our 10 day stay as was not practical to move around the room at night with the bed out. In hindsight we should’ve booked the bigger room for 3. I was disappointed by receptions response- “all rooms are the same size” - no some have terraces!  Drying swimming gear / towels was an issue with no outdoor space saw a number of other rooms hanging towels and underwear on bushes outside their room!  That said the decor is really lovely super comfy beds and lovely linen! Amazing aircon! Housekeeping helpful and prompt (when reception remembered to pass on a message!)    Reception: mixed bag check in was great but didn’t want to deal with our room issues and communication wasn’t great during our stay. I suspect it’s because they were fully booked. It’s certainly an area for improvement in the hotel but wouldn’t stop us returning!    Pool : lovely depth whilst lively never over crowded great activities through the day but not intrusive if you want to relax! Life guard on duty!    The grounds are constantly being tended it’s a lovely resort with great layout not too big but enough for a lovely atmosphere!    The team make it! We had a wonderful holiday there are a few tweaks that could turn this from good to great!  Thanks again to Niako and the gang for being exceptional!

Review_Date: lydiamilll wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: What a beautiful hotel and fantastic animation staff with such talent. My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our 10 day stay at Sol Oasis particularly down to Sam who I will mention a bit later.    My partner and I arrived at Sol Oasis at around 11:30am and were told that our room was delayed due to people checking out late… after reading another review that has said the same thing I am unsure now if this is true or if it’s just something the hotel says when they / the cleaners are running behind. Anyway - We were told the wait would be around an hour or two and this was fine - it gave us the chance to get some lunch from the buffet to look around the grounds and to have a little nap as we were tired from travelling. My partner asked reception again after around 2 hours and were told it was still not ready. We initially were told that we had an upgraded room so we were happy to wait for a bit longer. Fast forward around 5 hours time and the room is finally ready for us …. It is the same standard relatively small room - why did this take 5 hours to get ready? We had absolutely no issue in having a standard room and they are well decorated clean and sleek - but we did have a problem being told it was a VIP room for it to then be a standard room that took 5 hours to prepare for nothing more than a towel swan and some flower petals on the bed.    Now back to super Sam… From the very beginning Sam was welcoming entertaining and helpful. He is such an intelligent and informative man speaking fluently 4 languages and therefore able to engage with practically everyone who enters the hotel. Sam is so engaging and warm and encourages all guests to have a great time and immerse themselves in the local culture - he hosts Arabic lessons Moroccan tea workshops and a Turkish coffee one too - these were all fantastic and allowed us to meet and make friendships with other guests too. Sam is friendly and takes the time to learn things about the guests - he remembers your name where you are from and other things about you that make you feel really special and valued as a guest! Sam often sits with different guests of an evening and gets involved in your conversation so easily! What a great man and a pleasure to have met.    Enough about Sam as I could praise him all day!…    Other members of the animation team were quite flat in comparison to Sam… I couldn’t even tell you more than 2 of their names and there are 12 on the team. We found that some of the team approached my partner once at the beginning of our stay and that was it for the rest of the holiday but some of them still expected a review to be written praising them etc. e.g. one of the animation staff who I will not name approached me for the very first time on our last night and asked that I write a trip advisor review in front of her so that she could screenshot it and show her manager. Prior to this I wasn’t even aware of her name and had never spoken to her…. We also found that some staff members had a bit of a weird fascination with certain guests and buzzed around them like flies constantly (as in literally all day); ignoring everyone else.    The entertainment itself was fantastic and the staff were so full of life and energy - you can tell how much they enjoy their jobs and they are really good at what they do. There was a nice array of activities that you could take part in on site and I would definitely recommend getting involved.    The pool is lovely - a really decent size and nice depth. Clean water and a good amount of beds around. You can also bring your drink to the edge which is nice.    I am a cocktail lover and was so keen to try the substantial group of drinks that the hotel officers but was quite disappointed by the taste of many of them and by day 3 was drinking only Mojitos. The alcohol tasted quite funny in most of the cocktails and the cups were a little dirty on occasions with lipstick on them and grime. Unfortunately the sky bar / rooftop bar was not open throughout the duration of our stay and we would’ve loved to have experienced that.    My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed the food and as we are big foodies we were keen to try the local dishes. The tagines were our favourite! The flavours of the food were great and we enjoyed the selection of breads cold foods including salads and pastas and the hot foods that included different types of rices tagines vegetables etc. There were lots of food options but I would say not for the fussy eaters as there were not many plain/basic foods. In addition to this for some reason there was fish and meat etc chucked in to random dishes that didn’t need it. Chunks of ham in the coleslaw and calamari in the creamy pasta meant that many dishes wouldn’t have been suitable for vegetarians when they easily could have been. Also there was extremely limited to no allergen information next to the food so a lot of the time it was just guessing what you were eating - I would suggest if you have allergies to do some serious digging or avoid the food.    The cleaners are absolutely on it - we had fresh towels every single day even when we didn’t put them on the shower floor for washing. Not so environmentally friendly but definitely clean! Cleaners were also very helpful and polite.    We liked the free shuttle service to the main Marrakech area but be sure to avoid the people who greet you off the bus as they claim they work for the hotel and are there to guide you to the centre / souks but are ultimately looking to con you.    Marrakech city itself is unbelievable - a hustling bustling scene with monkeys and cobras in the square and an array of smells and colours. Enjoy haggling with and speaking to the shop owners but be wary tourists are an easy target for them to make lots of money! Always half the asking price or less.

Review_Date: AdamEddie97 wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Where do I begin with this hotel? I will begin like any good story at the beginning. We arrived at the beautiful ‘sol oasis’ at approximately 11.30 am on the 21st of august 2022 we climbed out of the taxi and was greeted by a very smiley and approachable security guard at the front gate who asked for me details and checked them off on his sheet quickly after this we was approached by a young fellow who took our suitcases from us so we didn’t have to walk with them which was a nice touch. We entered the beautifully decorated and clean and lovely smelling reception and made our way to the front desk where we spoke with a very stern and serious receptionist. He stated that as we was having a special room our room wasn’t quite ready yet we was fine with this and went for a wander around the grounds as unfortunately the reception staff didn’t provide us with much information about the hotel itself who we had to fend for ourselves in that sense until we found a useful map. Had some lunch and some drinks and then sat in the sofa section of the lobby… FAST FORWARD TO 5 HOURS and our room was finally ready again the nice fellow took our suitcases to the room for us which was again a nice touch. We entered our room to see that it was just a standard room (which was still lovely) and the only difference was that there was a swan made from towels on the bed it was lovely for them to do this however should it have taken 5 hours? Baring in mind we had been awake since 1am we wanted nothing more than to unpack and unwind.    We de-kitted our belongings and went to the pool for the afternoon which was lovely perfect depth not too deep and not too shallow my only criticism is there are a number of missing tiles in the pool which can seriously damage someone’s foot. The lifeguards were friendly and attentive and regularly did water aerobics. (LOTS OF CHILDREN BE AWARE)    The buffet restaurant was clean and well kept. The food was amazing all kinds of tagines and various other Moroccan delicacies my only concern is the lack of labelling there are no labels with ingredients displayed which can be difficult for people with allegories or tolerances. And secondly they like to chuck meat in random places (coleslaw rice etc) which again is an issue for vegetarians.    The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels which was lovely and the cleaners were very polite and helpful.    Now onto the entertainment/animation team… where to begin? I’ll save the best for last. On an evening there is usually a show performed by the animation team which is very good lots of skilled dancing and performances from Michael Jackson impressions to backflips to playing with fire. During the day the animation team encourage guests to take part in numerous games and activities darts archery volleyball football and lots of water games. My only issue with the some of the animation team is that they pick a guest and forget about everyone else… I guess it is fine and makes people feel more comfortable hopeful I noticed a slight trend that the male animation team became more inclined to spend time with females. Now onto the cherry on the cake the godsend the king himself Sam I having nothing but respect for this man. Remembers everyone’s names engages with EVERYONE very funny cheeky silly and remembers stories from conversations you have with him. Sam is a book of history and education teaching you all you need to know about marrakech the basic language how to make and enjoy Moroccan tea how to act in the souks and he’s a good dancer Sam is hands down a legend and deserves every bit of recognition he can get. If you visit be sure to hunt this fellow down.    Things to be aware of:  - pool towels are available but require a 100 MAD deposit per towel or whatever the equivalent in euros it may be.  - Do not use the on-site store as it’s very overpriced (£17 for a bottle of aftersun)  - Be sure to get involved and have fun!    Thank you SOL OASIS! It’s been great and I’ll be referring friends and family to this magnificent hotel.

Review_Date: Kirandscott wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The hotel itself is very nice lovely grounds which are well kept. A small room but it had everything you needed - the balcony was very small and backed onto a muddy area which was odd.    The food was great a lovely choice and really tasty there was an issue with wasps however so that does need looking into. The drinks were great but the que for the bar not so great there is no waiter service as such as everyone was so busy.    No water in your room which can be a problem if you forget to grab some from the bar before it closes.    You need to be up at 7.30 to get a sun bed it was crazy how people were allowed to put towels out and then go off out for the day. The sun shades were broken so I felt sorry for the staff struggling to put them up!    The evening entertainment was great lovely animation staff and some great singers.    We asked for a late check out and we were happy to pay what ever the cost but the reception staff were not interested. They clearly had rooms available to book online so I’m unsure why they were making it so difficult and refused to accommodate our request. There is no where to shower so we ended up coming out of our room at 12 then flying at night with no rest or shower. We also asked to change money at reception and we’re told they didn’t have any.    Bus service is really good and needed as the hotel is in the middle of nowhere… it drops you off a fair way from the medina - dont go off with the guides just look for the tall mosque and you can find it yourselves.    Medina was fab as usual - always love the shopping and haggling.    We have been to Morocco several times and we did find the service lacking in this hotel - it could be that it was august and they were busy but maybe the owners need to hire more staff.    Unsure if we would return to this hotel as we found reception staff difficult and the fact the sun beds were hard to come by and we spent most our holiday sat next to the bar due to this.

Review_Date: Lewis1966 wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Not too sure where to start but what a week myself and my partner had at the sol oasis Marrakech! We took our own thermal cups which kept our drinks cool and saved having to use the plastic glasses around the pool.  The other reviews mention the entertainment staff a lot which I was pretty skeptical of since we usually don't tend to get involved in the games and entertainment during the day. However the reviews were right! The entertainment staff made our holiday one to remember they go out of their way to speak to you and generally enjoy a conversation and engaging with people. There were a few which stood out from the outset which we got on really well with and made our holiday constantly amusing with their humourous personalities - Russ SouSou Niako (Snoop!) And Mike. We even went into Marrakech with a couple of them for a few drinks which was great - it was a pleasure meeting them and we look forward to meeting up with them again.  Niako - hope the Gardner's fixed the hose pipe at archery lol!    Thanks again for a great week. Couldn't fault the hotel and the reviews are right the entertainment staff do make this hotel one to remember!!

Review_Date: Ste wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The hotel itself is nice. The staff are really friendly and helpful and the animation team are brilliant and work very hard.    The hotel has a lot of potential but the service was not quite what we expected and we felt it was advertised in the wrong way. We came here with high expectations and we were disappointed when we arrived. It really needs to state it only has one restaurant as this leaves guests disappointed. We were told other than the main buffet restaurant one was open but you have to pay for it (which is fine) but it was never open to serve food. I am not even sure why it says there are 3 as another isn’t even an option.    We stayed for 10 nights and it was pretty cheap overall so I guess you get what you pay for.    Pros  Very clean  Spacious and modern rooms  Nice bar area by reception  Housekeeping clean room everyday with fresh towels and very friendly  Hotel grounds are nice ( a little smaller than expected)  All of entertainment team are very good.  Shuttle bus is good and the driver is great  Staff overall are friendly and helpful    Cons  IT DOES NOT HAVE 3 RESTAURANTS! One of the reasons we booked the hotel because it advertises 3 restaurants. It has one large buffet room. The 2 other so called restaurants are not restaurants. At best one is a late night bar that serves drinks you have to pay for. I seen this open once in the 10 days I stayed here and it opened at 11pm. The other room next to it is basically to drink morrocan tea for an hour in the afternoon with a very polite host.    The food is average at best and repetitive.    The late breakfast snacks and the afternoon snacks are the same everyday. Breakfast snacks are pastries and afternoon are meat wrapped in crepes and more pastries and sometimes pizza and candy floss for the kids.    We had to ask to moved rooms as the entrainment was too loud and we have a one year old.    The sky bar is never open    Make sure you book the shuttle bus a few days in advance as it does get full and the taxis are not cheap - about £22 each way.    As a family hotel with lots of children I found it very bizarre that you do not get free ice cream for all inclusive. I was charged £4 for a magnum in the shop. The only time Ice cream is available is at the evening meal and you have the option of vanilla or a chocolate scoop in a bowl.    The cocktails are bad and poor quality    Not much service around the pool area    The pool party on Saturday night is really loud. Especially when you have a 1 year old in bed. We were far back aswell so can’t imagine what it’s like by the pool.    Overall I wish I did more research and paid a little bit more to stay in a better hotel as this hotel isn’t really for me but I can see how families with kids love it. It is very energetic with a lot going on and the entertainment team are very good. If my daughter was a little older she would of loved it. I wouldn’t say this is a peaceful hotel at all.

Review_Date: Elliot R wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: A few pros, lots of cons. Room for improvement but not a complete write off..
Review_Text: So this is our 2nd visit to Marrakech 1st to the Sol Oasis by Melia.  I’m going to list the pros and the cons  I’ll start with the PROS    1. The entertainment team is fantastic Sam Nioki Russ Medhi (Michael Jackson) and Zizou are all fantastic. Sam seems to be the “leader” and his interaction with the guests of all cultures is amazing fluent in a number of languages and funny with it as well he makes you feel included and made the holiday very enjoyable. As did the other reps as well.  2. The snack bar was fantastic offering daily snacks of Cheeseburgers Shwarma Salad bar stone baked pizza there really was a great variety of choice.  3. Cleanliness of rooms (I need to stress this is about the rooms only this will become clear in the negatives)  The housekeeping staff here are very thorough kind polite staff changing towels daily making the beds cleaning the floors. Everyday the rooms smelt fresh and clean I can’t fault their effort and attention to detail.    Now to the CONS.    1. Cleanliness of the drinks glass/plastic cups etc.  Everyday we had a drink and the glassware (sometimes plastic depending on where you’re sitting) was filthy. When I addressed this I was assured they were clean and they were just scratches on the glass/plastic. This wasn’t the case I took one of the cups back to my room and wiped it myself and the what was left on the towel was a disgusting yellow grease like residue. It was seriously gross.  2. Drinks.  They literally give you any drink. I asked for rum and coke instead of telling me they’d run out of rum they just poured gin instead. When I challenged they said I was wrong. During the entire week I don’t think I drank the same drink twice. They just literally make the cocktails up as they go along.  I assume that their could be an issue with allergies etc if you’re not getting what you asked for and are unassumingly served something you didn’t want. This needs addressing. There doesn’t seem to be any management of the bar staff.  That being said the majority of them were all polite and friendly but they all flat out lied about what they were serving you. Speaking to numerous other couples and families this happened to everyone.  3. The a la carte restaurant.  This for us was a USP for the hotel. Somewhere you could break away from the normal all inclusive buffet and have a special meal don’t mind paying at all for that nice 3 course Spanish themed menu that was advertised when we booked.  We asked at reception when it was open. Every night we were told.  Of the 7 nights we stayed it didn’t open once. Admittedly after the 1st 2nd and 3rd night and each of those being told it would be “open tomorrow from 7pm” and it not being we gave up asking. Again talking to other families they had the same experience. It just seems a big waste of income for the hotel and a reason alienate and frustrate guests.  Average meal on the a la carte was 80-120 Dirhams. So potentially 400D per couple not including drinks. Why advertise it if they’re not going to open it. Or at least be honest and say it’s not open. Very disappointed.  4. “Skybar”  We saw on trip advisor that the Skybar was an excellent addition to Sol Oasis a premium bar that was outside the normal all inclusive allowance but offered a calmer chilled experience. It never opened. Not on any night..  5. Extras..  We often wanted to buy a can of coke for the room or a Fanta lemon etc. none of the 2 bars had a till so they couldn’t change the notes for you. It was like you were asking for the world. You’d think they’d want people to buy drinks as that’s outside the all inclusive so the mark up must be high and profitable. No not this place.    All in all Sol Oasis is not a complete write off. Everything I’ve stated that’s negative can be improved on. If they’re aiming to be anything like the Iberostar then they have to improve. But the place does have everything it needs to be success the grounds are beautiful the staff are willing. The entertainment staff are literally the body and soul of the venue and they lucky to have such good people.  Table service would be a welcome touch. The food at lunch time and breakfast is good can get a bit repetitive but the standard is good. Breakfast could be better.  I would love to come back in 2 years time and experience a better Sol Oasis.

Review_Date: Jasmin wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Great 4 day stay at Sol Oasis
Review_Text: We stayed at this lovely hotel between 8th-12th july during Eid.  Can I just start by saying all the other reviews were right in saying the staff are amazing at this hotel. So friendly and very welcoming. The grounds are stunning and the hotel gives a very modern but traditional Moroccan vibe.    Rooms- we stayed in room 2402 (family xtra suite).Very spacious modern and the beds were comfortable. We had 1 large double bed and a sofa bed. All rooms are situated close to the pool areas.    Food - food was very fresh and tasty. there was always something different to eat everyday. There was a mix of many different Foods such as Tagines lasagna pizza roast chicken kofte etc. they also had a snack place outside which we would usually eat at around 4pm which was nice however I was quite disappointed to see that once they had ran out of the mini pizza slices they wouldn’t re stock again so once they were gone they were gone basically! For an all inclusive hotel I did expect the pizzas to be re filled if was empty. Other than that I can’t fault the food/drinks. They had lovely mock tails too.    Kids club- kids club was one of the best kids club we had seen in terms of how great the girls are there with the children!! We had a 3 year old with us and she absolutely loved going to the club everyday. Special shout out to Susu Zisou and Waheba…they really do go the extra mile and are always so so happy and bubbly. We felt comfortable to leave our 3 year old with them where as we normally don’t leave her in kids clubs abroad and venture about but these girls made us feel so at ease. They truly are amazing at their jobs and they deserve all the recognition they can get. Well done girls and we miss you all!    Entertainment- again entertainment was amazing. There was always something different going on at night. There was shows in the amphitheatre as well as live singers and shows outside by the bar area. On Eid night There was a special show which was really nice and they had lit up lovely fireworks around the pool (I’ll attach some pics). Shoutout to the entertainment guys Michael and the other few boys I’ve forgotten their names but they all were very friendly and great to chat to.    Location- we booked our private transfer through Hoppa.com. Transfer time to the hotel from Marrakech airport is around 25-35mins. This hotel is located on the outskirts and there’s not much to see nearby however the hotel does offer a free return shuttle service everyday into city centre which is great. I believe they run it at 3-4 times a day.    I would definitely say I would return back here but just not in July as temperatures are scorching. It was almost 45 degrees everyday whilst we was there!    Well done SOL OASIS your hotel is fantastic!  We hope to be back very soon :)

Review_Date: Natalie S wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Brilliant Hotel just outside hustle and bustle of Marrakech! Absolute Oasis!
Review_Text: We've just got back from a 7-day trip to Marrakech and we stayed at the Sol Oasis Marrakech and absolutely adored it! The staff are truly what makes this hotel what it is - they have an entertainment team of approx. 12 that are always on hand to make your experience great. Whilst there we did Aqua Aerobics Darts Archery - and many more activities available!    The rooms are lovely and clean - pillows and beds are VERY comfy and the shower is brilliant. Room Service came everyday to refill towels/toilet roll which is a nice touch. Lovely big toiletries in the bathroom so no shortage there! Basic TV but does have few english news channels. Air con was brilliant especially as it was 38 degrees when we were there! Also great fridge in room. One downside was for two people there wasn't a lot of storage space in wardrobe for hanging clothes.    The gardens around the hotel are extremely beautiful and were being groomed every morning! Few cute little cats around site 3/4 - but not needy and very well fed! Pool is absolutely stunning - when we went in the weekday it was very quiet - however does pack out at the weekends. However sunbeds are very easily found and your never short of options - so no need to grab one early! And the sunbeds and umbrellas are of very high quality.    Food wise it was stunning! Always had traditional tagines out for Lunch and Dinner - which were DELICIOUS. But also had more classic options like Paella Burgers Fish Lasagne etc so everyone was happy! Lovely pastries and fresh orange juice in the morning with a range of cereals crepes and pancakes. Best wine I've had at an all inclusive hotel especially the rose and white - and lots of it! Only downside was the lack of good coffee the coffee in the machines weren't great - so that could be one improvement - but always did have Mint Tea on hand as well! Absolutely amazing desserts at Lunch and Dinner and lots of yummy juices for breakfast.    There's one bar near the pool which did often have quite a few queues - so more staff on the weekend would help when busier. Absolutely amazing list of included cocktails that were delightful especially the mojito! However if you do enjoy premium spirits although you can buy them (approx. 40-50 dh) the bar weirdly doesn't seem to have a cash register so can't always provide change straight away - so had to ask them a few times. So again that would be an improvement! But bar staff were all so delightful and very quick to serve!    Staff on reception were lovely. Bit of tax to pay on check in (approx £23 for 7 nights) - brilliant shuttle bus that runs 6 times a day. The reception space is absolutely delightful and so peaceful. Very well kept! Lots of sitting space across the grounds and very disabled friendly with lots of ramps! I went to the gym on site 2/3 times and lots of nice modern equipment however wasn't any air-con so that could be one slight improvement. Also brilliant sites for volleyball tennis and badmington!    As mentioned previously - the staff are just incredible! Big shout out to Sam Niako Russ Sousou Zisou Michael. Also the bar and waiting staff Soufane Mehdi and Machino were all amazing - they were always happy to help and there with a smile! Lots to do if you have kids and lots of activities for the adults to join in on including making Mint Tea Learning Arabic Bellydancing - and lots more! My only one improvement would be that sometimes I turned up to classes eg Yoga TRX - to see they weren't on or member of staff were off - so maybe an updated daily schedule of whats on on the board near the pool would be great? But whats on offer is incredible including Yoga TRX Spin Aqua Aerobics Volleyball Water Polo etc. So much to do!  The evening entertainment was also great with Latin Night Oriental Night Moroccan Night all with 30-40 dance routines - incredible! Other nights included Just Dance Night Bingo and Karoake.    One slight improvement was that on checkout we handed in our bags - and I don't believe they have luggage storage so bags were left in the lobby until collection (4 hrs) and they also don't have a shower room - which would be appreciated if your leaving for the airport later and want a shower after the pool. And there could be more hand sanitizing stations across site.    All in all absolutely brilliant stay would definitely come back and THANK YOU SOL OASIS FOR AN AMAZING HOLIDAY!

Some things can be a little cold as occasionally happens at a buffet but overall this is very good food for an all-inclusive. Overall though a great hotel at what is a very reasonable price – you won’t regret choosing it.

Review_Date: David Blake wrote a review Jun 2022

Review_Text: A very nice hotel on the outskirts of Marrekesh with lovely grounds. The room was spacious and clean with a Berber twist. Food was excellent quality and varied throughout the week. This was particularly annoying when the private parties went on until the early hours and drinks were still being served to them. Perhaps keep the lobby bar open later?    However these are minor things for what was a great break at a great price.    Top tips - Join Melia Rewards before making the booking then book directly via their website for a discounted price. You can then use your 2000 welcome points to get it even cheaper.    At Marrakech airport on the way home you still need to go to the check in desk to get a boarding stamp even if you have no baggage and have already checked in online. Saves a long walk back from the security hall.
